meanings.definition: To move incorrectly or in a faulty manner.
meanings.sent1: She was mismoving the furniture and almost dropped it.
meanings.sent2: The robot was mismoving its arms, causing it to malfunction.
meanings.sent3: The cat was mismoving around the room, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dancer was mismoving to the beat, creating a unique performance.
meanings.sent5: His mismoving on the ice made him slip and fall.

meanings.definition: Moving in a way that is not smooth or coordinated.
meanings.sent1: The mismoving car made strange noises as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent2: Her mismoving hair kept getting tangled in the wind.
meanings.sent3: The mismoving clock ticked irregularly, confusing everyone in the room.
meanings.sent4: The mismoving branches of the tree cast eerie shadows on the ground.
meanings.sent5: The mismoving boat rocked unsteadily in the rough waters.
